page.title: 16CHURCH BELLS, POTT SHRIGLEY.
page.content: A Bell-fund project has been established at St. Christopher's Church in order to increase the three existing bells to six, producing the acceptable sound of method ringing which makes British churches unique in Europe. Two old bells were cast in 1437 and the third in 1607, any new bells will have to be tuned to fit in with them. After two years Â£8,000 has been raised by dry-stone wall repairs, endowments, sponsored walks, bell metal bought for melting and bank interest. Around Â£11,000 will be needed, a Herculean task for a village of some 230 inhabitants.
